fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create 3000+ users that have the *Assignable User* permission
# Open an existing issue.  
# Click on the assign button and change on the assignee

The above steps will throw the following exception, 
"A script on this page is causing Internet Explorer to run slowly":
!scripterror.png|thumbnail!

This seems to a limitation on IE8.  According to this [Microsoft KB|http://support.microsoft.com/kb/175500], the *Fix it 50403* will remove the script error.  However, the time it takes to display the assignee list will take a long time.  (Ie. One scenario takes 30 seconds for 1000 users)

The problem does not occur on Firefox, Chrome, or IE9
fields.summary: Script Error is thrown when assigning an issue on IE8

fields.description:
We linking an issue, it's possible for us to use the Issue Selector to add issues to be linked with. However when we use a custom project key pattern and open the Issue Selector, clicking the suggested issue keys doesn't return anything. If we select the multiple issues option, we can check on the check box but the "Select issues" button will not work as well. 

A sample screenshot displaying the issue selector:
!selector.png!

Steps to reproduce:
- Run JIRA 5.0.x
- Go to {{Administration > General Configuration > Advanced}}, and configure the project key pattern:
{noformat}
^([0-9]{3,3}\.[0-9]{3,3}(\.[A-Z][0-9A-Z]{0,3}){0,1})$|^([0-9]{5}\.[A-Za-z]{1,1}[0-9A-Za-z]{1,7})$
{noformat}
- Create a new project using the key pattern, eg: 00001.ABCDEFG
- Create a couple of issues
- Try to link those issues using the issue collector, via {{More Actions > Link > click on the 'plus' icon}}, try to select any of the issues suggested

Tested this on JIRA 5.2 as well, and I may confirm that the problem is still reproducible in the mentioned version.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Selector window is not working when we use a custom project key pattern

fields.description:
As seen on SAC (5.1.8 at the time, but this is likely to be true for all of 5.x) ...

An OutOfMemoryError inside the IndexWriter leaves it in a permanently bad state.  This is because the IndexWriter remembers that once upon a time it saw an OOME, and keeps a flag set that is checked in many places to deliberately prevent you from using that IndexWriter ever again.  This makes some sense, and is very clearly documented in the [IndexWriter docs|http://lucene.apache.org/core/old_versioned_docs/versions/3_2_0/api/core/org/apache/lucene/index/IndexWriter.html].

As stated there (see the first "Note"), this is because Lucene can't be sure that the writer's internal state is valid, and allowing a commit() to proceed could corrupt the index.  The only corrective action that can be taken is to close the IndexWriter, which can then be reopened.  Any writes to it since the previous commit are lost, but at least future writes can go through.

A cursory examination and recent problem report from the support team shows that we do not do this.  The OutOfMemoryError (or IllegalStateException, if the OOME happened earlier), is passed up the call stack and the IndexWriter is not closed.  Therefore, the IndexWriter remains unusable and the index state can remain stale indefinitely.
fields.summary: JIRA is not handling an OOME in Lucene's IndexWriter correctly

At my company we use a shared google calendar to denote more detailed information about versions release schedule, as well as company events, etc.

It would be most useful to show this on the JIRA dashboard. The Google calendar is very easy to embed, but we can't do it in JIRA on demand as the text gadget is (rightly) not available there.

I think you should offer a very simple widget where the user just configures the link to an iFrame source. The list of sources can be limited to only well-known, safe web sites such as google calendar. Or the entire widget can be about google calendar only.

The link looks something like this:
http://www.google.com/calendar/embed?src=identifierhere%40group.calendar.google.com&ctz=America/Denver"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30883].
  {panel}

We recently upgraded to Jira 5.1.8, and it's been working pretty well. However, in-line editing of simple fields such as labels or Version fields can be pretty slow. 
What's actually slow is the time taken to "save" the field. The reason I emphasize "save" is that Jira is not just saving the new data, but also receiving a lot of data back from the server as part of the response. I accept there's a certain amount of latency in our case between the client and server, but there's a distinct data issue which plays a much larger part in the perception of the speed of the save action

How much data depends on the individual Jira instance, and in our case it's approx. 600kb. Looking at the http response details with the Chrome developer tools shows that it's essentially getting a fresh copy of all of the fields (system & custom) and field values that are applicable to the issue in question.

This is hugely wasteful for a simple field update. There's a couple of options here:
# Improve the response so the client is only retrieving the refreshed field values, and updating/appending the DOM accordingly
# When the value is submitted, check to see if any of the other issue fields have been updated (by other users working on the same issue), and retrieve those updated/added values along with the field you're currently updating

Either way, the goal is have only what is being updated being returned to the browser and possibly having a little more intelligence on the client side around inserting what is effectively a diff.

FWIW, we're using GZIP compression, so the 600KB is the compressed size
fields.summary: Inline edit of single fields causes disproportionate data transfer

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install JIRA 5.1.7
# Create two users
# Disable JQL Auto Complete in the Issue Navigators advanced search section for one of the users
# Upgrade JIRA to version 5.2.1

h3. Expected results
- The ability to enable JQL auto complete for the user that had it disabled is no longer there
- Presumed that JQL auto complete would be enabled/disabled for all users since it seems like it is no longer possible to control this on a per user basis

h3. Actual results
- JQL auto complete is disabled for the user(s) that had it disabled before upgrading
- The user(s) are unable to enable JQL auto complete

h3. Notes:
There are still some entries in the database keeping the JQL auto complete disabled for users that had it disabled prior to upgrading:
{code:sql}
select propertyvalue from propertynumber where id in(select id from propertyentry where property_key='user.jql.autocomplete.disabled')
{code}

h3. Workaround/Resolution
1. Run this query against JIRA's database to identify if any users have JQL auto complete disabled:
{code:sql}
select propertyvalue from propertynumber where id in(select id from propertyentry where property_key='user.jql.autocomplete.disabled')
{code}
2. If any rows return a value of '1' then JQL auto complete is disabled for certain users
3. Run this query to enable JQL auto complete for all users that have it disabled:
{code:sql}
update propertynumber set propertyvalue='0' where id in(select id from propertyentry where property_key='user.jql.autocomplete.disabled');
{code}

(!) Please make sure to take a backup of your data prior to making any changes on the database level.
fields.summary: JQL auto complete disabled on a user basis after upgrading to 5.2.x

Here is the steps to reproduce the issue: 
# Create a new user with the user name like "test\123456".
# Assigne one issue to this user. 
# Re assigne the same issue to other user. 
# Assigne the issue back to the same user, then we can observe that the same user name "test\123456" display many time in the suggestion list. 

Impact: the suggestion list will increase with the same user name on each search request, and the web browser will finally hang as it run into 100% CPU.

Workaround solution: 
# Remove the slash in the user name.
# Upgrade to JIRA 5.2.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30858].
  {panel}

*My Environment*
* JIRA 5.1.3
* iPad 2 running iOS 5.1.1 (9B206), and the version of Safari it comes with
* Chrome version 23.0.1271.91

*Description*

When using Chrome or Safari on my iPad2, it is not possible to restrict the visibility of a comment to a group.

Specifically, while adding add a comment to a JIRA issue, or editing an existing comment:
# Click on the lock symbol to restrict which group can see the comment.
# JIRA pops up the list of available groups.
# Select one of the groups.
# The popup list disappears, as expected.
# JIRA has not selected the group, however; it still has "Viewable by All Users" selected.

Both Safari and Chrome exhibit the problem.

*Impact*

A particularly annoying aspect of this is that, unless you are paying close attention, you could assume that JIRA has set the group, and then go ahead and save the comment. I just did this, and sent out a comment to a customer that was for internal eyes only.

*Question*

Do you fully support JIRA on the iPad? Even if you don't, I'm sure you want to know about the issue. :-)
fields.summary: Cannot restrict comment visibility when using iPad

fields.description:
I have set an issue security scheme for one of our projects.

There is only one security level (hence, it is the default). (see issue-security1.jpg)

Upon creating a new issue, that security level is not applied to the issue.

Trying to associate the security scheme again shows that there are issues that have no security level but it doesn't allow to set the level again. "The project is already associated with this scheme" (see issue-security2.jpg)

This seems to happen only if the security level field is hidden in the field configuration. (Although it wouldn't be shown to the normal user in any case because lack of permission.)
fields.summary: default issue security not used when security level field hidden (and error message)

fields.description:
We have a company with multiple users and many security group in our Active Directory.

For clarity, we have separated our Jira Groups in our Active Directory
org/atlassian/3rdParties/Jira/

Users are crawled from the domain root, therefor
org/atlassian/
And the group use the sub-path 3rdParties/Jira

Various management groups can be found under the root
org/atlassian/Office1/Developers/
org/atlassian/Office2/Marketing/

If a nested group refer to a group that is *not* under org/atlassian/3rdParties/Jira/ it is ignored

For instance, if we want to add a group in Jira, jira-developers, that has 
org/atlassian/Office1/Developers/all-developers as a member,  this will be ignored.
On the other hand, if org/atlassian/3rdParties/Jira/myTestGroup is added, it will be added.


This restriction render nested group unusable on organized Directory where group are isolated per function or physical location.  Nested group should be able to follow any member group no matter where it is located in the active directory.
fields.summary: Sibling and parent Nested Groups ignored when resolving members

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30830].
  {panel}

Sadly it seems that importing attachments in OnDemand using http fails. What's also odd is that I have a regular Apache webserver I can use to provide attachment files, and this works in the browser (including directory contents). Accessing the file using the Java code in HttpDownloader.java from my machine is fine, but from an OnDemand server I get a 403 error. Weird.

The attached file contains the minimal set of code to test access to attachments using http. I don't have permission to run it on an atlassian.net server to confirm the failure.

h3. Update

The attachments to be imported should be available via 80 (http) or 443 (https) ports. Our OnDemand instnaces are blocking outgoing connections on all ports other than those.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30828].
  {panel}

Improvement request:

For example, attached is what is at the top of the dialog when I close an Issue. It says, "Closing an issue indicates that there is no more work to be done on it, and that it has been verified as complete."

That is a pretty good generic description. But in our workflow, we differentiate between Closing an Issue and Resolving an Issue. In our use, "Closing" means we are not going to do any thing about the Issue.

I want to be able to change that text to better prompt the user.

I am told I can change it here: /atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport.properties

But that's not a good approach if for no other reason than it is hard to do and prone to getting overwritten with a JIRA update.

I would like this ability for all of these text strings. For example, I would like to change the text for the Resolve step too.
fields.summary: As an administrator I want to be able to customize the text that appears at the top of the workflow dialogs

fields.description:
When adding a large list of users (up to a few 100 users) to the project role, the user picker will be failed throwing the error message "The server is temporary not reachable" (like in the screen shot). The root cause could be that the header of the HTTP request exceed the default header size limit ( maxHttpHeaderSize by default set to 8192) defined in the file server.xml.

*Workaround #1*
Increase the maxHttpHeaderSize in your Tomcat configuration:
* Edit $JIRA-installation-directory/conf/server.xml file
* Find the connector tag used to configure connections to JIRA, if you're using the default server.xml configuration, it should look something like this for example:
{code}
<Connector port="8080" maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" connectionTimeout="20000" enableLookups="false" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" protocol="HTTP/1.1" useBodyEncodingForURI="true" redirectPort="8443" acceptCount="100" disableUploadTimeout="true"/>
{code}
* Increase the value of the maxHttpHeaderSize parameter e.g. maxHttpHeaderSize="32656" (If your connector tag doesn't have this parameter you should add it manually)
* Restart JIRA for the changes to take effect.

*Workaround #2*
 Assign groups to project roles, instead of separate users

fields.description:
When trying to remove mail signatures beginning with - from comments, putting split regex with \-$\ or \^-\ does not catch the signature mark {noformat}(-){noformat}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
Create mail handler with type "Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body" with split regex = /^-/ or  /-$/

*Expected Results:*
JIRA should remove all text following the - beginning a line on the message content
e.g.:
{noformat}
This is the message content
-
Marcus Silveira
Atlassian Support
{noformat}
JIRA should add 'This is the message content' as a comment.

*Actual Results:*
JIRA adds the whole message, with the signature.
fields.summary: Split regex not handling '^' and '$' metacharacters at mail handler

fields.description:
When configuring a high value for the database pool in the dbconfig.xml file, the Connection Pool graph y axis seems to be broken:
!scshot1.png!

Steps to reproduce:
- Configure a high value for the <pool\-min\-size> and <pool\-max\-size> (eg: 60)
- Restart JIRA
- Go to {{Administration > Database Monitoring}}
fields.summary: Connection Pool graph y axis values are not properly displayed when we set a high database pool value

fields.description:
1. Use test data such that there are two projects with same component labels, may differ in the case.
If you use JIRA5.1_QAData.zip, two such projects are, 'BULK Move 1' and 'Bulk Move 2'.
These 2 projects have components 
 - cheese ( Bulk Move 1)
 - Cheese ( Bulk Move 2)


2. Perform a search on the project 'Bulk Move 1' and criteria - 'Component' with value 'cheese' selected.

3. Add another project to the search that does not have the same component. E.g. QA.

4. Get rid of the QA project from the search since the component field shows an error and is greyed out.

5. Search gets broadened by including the component 'Cheese' with no effort from user. And the Component field shows an error.

!braoadened_search.png!
fields.summary: New issue navigator broadens the user's search that has 'Component' criteria

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30795].
  {panel}

1) Go to KA basic search on JDog.
2) Add the "Rank" or "Global Rank" field as criteria.
3) Click on the new field.

You get an empty dropdown:
!Rank.png!

I've marked this as Minor because this searcher doesn't work in either Classic or KA in advanced mode - e.g. "Rank = 15475" returns no results on JDog, even though displaying the Rank column shows there is an issue with that rank.
fields.summary: GreenHopper rank field displays a blank searcher in KA

fields.description:
The logic in the IssueAssignHistoryListener history listener should be moved into AssigneeSystemField and removed from JIRA.

At the moment the UserHistoryItem.USED_USER history item for the current user is updated twice on every assign: once in the field and once in the listener. If the UserHistoryItem.ASSIGNEE is moved into the field from the listener, then the listener can be removed from JIRA. 

*NOTE*: This will require an upgrade task.
fields.summary: Pri 3 IssueAssignHistoryListener is now redundant now that we do all this in the field itself.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30787].
  {panel}

We'd like to get information in our emails showing why the recipient is receiving the email. By this, I mean showing the recipient what their relationship to the issue is, in the email contents. This can have tremendous value in larger teams, as a recipient's understanding of their relationship drives the decision of how to react to the issue event. It also has the nice effect of providing a mechanism for fast-filtering of different types of email notifications - e.g. if a user has email folders for "My Issues", "My Watched Issues", "My Reported Issues", etc.

To clarify in terms of user stories, this is what we want:
* As a user receiving an email notification for an issue event, I can immediately gather my relationship to the issue in the email contents.
* As a user receiving an email notification for an issue event, I only see one relationship.
** Ideally the most "direct" relationship to the issue is chosen.
** E.g., If the recipient is both the issue's Assignee and in a project role configured to receive all notifications for that issue's project, the relationship in the email notification should be "Assignee".
fields.summary: Add "Notification Role" to mail notification
Need ability to have available field values be driven by selection from another field

fields.description:
In a jira plugin, I am trying to make a web-item which defines  a link element to a non http absolute url.
Setting the attribute absolute to true is not taking effect. The uri define in the link is set at the end of the server url.


For exemple:
<web-item key="test" i18n-name-key="web.item.test" name="test" section="operations-work" weight="9">
                <label key="web.item.test"/>
                <tooltip key="web.item.test"/>
                <link linkId="test" absolute="true">ftp://test</link>
</web-item>


When clicking the web-item, we excpect the ftp://test url to be opened.
Instead of that, Jira tries to open the following url: http://localhost:2990/jiraftp://test
fields.summary: Web Item Link Elements: absolute attribute does not work
